short.en: The Beacon gains power as teammates die. After five deaths he is revealed to the terrorists.
short.de: Das Leuchtfeuer gewinnt an Kraft, wenn Teammitglieder sterben.

desc.en: The Beacon gains power as teammates die, improving stats like speed and damage. If they kill an innocent, they revert to a regular innocent and take damage. If they accumulate enough power, their role is revealed, becoming a trusted figure for the team.

short.en: Can see the special roles of all non-standard players.

desc.en: The Clairvoyant can see the special roles of all non-standard players. They can also kill the Jester without triggering its win condition, and after doing so, the Jester respawns as their Sidekick.

short.en: Makes two players fall in love with an invisible crossbow.

desc.en: Cupid starts with an invisible crossbow that makes two players fall in love. If used after someone's death, the effect is voided.

short.en: Lovers share damage; if one dies, the other also dies.

desc.en: Lovers split damage between them, but if one dies, the other dies of a broken heart. If on opposite teams, they form their own team to win when everyone else is dead.

short.en: Gets a power boost if they're the last innocent standing.

desc.en: The Lycanthrope gains a significant power boost if they're the last innocent standing, including increased speed, health, and damage.

short.en: Resurrects when their health drops below 25%.

desc.en: When the Occultist falls below 25% health, they are resurrected after death. They are fireproof but must beware of others being near their corpse, which will notify them of their revival.

short.en: Places an Ankh to revive themselves or create a Graverobber.

desc.en: The Pharaoh places an Ankh that converts a random Traitor into a Graverobber. If the Pharaoh dies, they can be revived by the Ankh unless stolen by the Graverobber.

short.en: Steals the Pharaoh's Ankh to revive themselves.

desc.en: The Graverobber works against the Pharaoh and can steal their Ankh, causing their own revival instead.

short.en: Respawns as a fast-moving figure with a list of traitors.

desc.en: The Shinigami respawns as a fast-moving figure with a list of traitors. They gradually lose health over time and cannot communicate.

short.en: Haunts their killer and revives if their killer dies.

desc.en: When killed, the Spectre haunts their killer. If their attacker dies, the Spectre is revived.

short.en: Blends with the Traitors but doesn't know their identity.

desc.en: A Spy has a shop and can blend with the Traitors, but they don't know who the Traitors are, while the Traitors don't know the Spy's role.

short.en: An enhanced Innocent with a configurable shop.

desc.en: An enhanced Innocent with a configurable shop similar to the Detective’s.

short.en: Detects traps and sees visual indicators when traps are used.

desc.en: The Trapper detects traps and sees visual indicators when traps are used. Other trap-users can also see when the Trapper uses a trap.

short.en: Turns into a Traitor if killed by an Innocent.

desc.en: If the Wrath is killed by an innocent, they become a Traitor, but if killed by anyone else, they die normally.

short.en: A Detective who can recruit deputies by shooting them.

desc.en: The Sheriff is a Detective with a DeputyDeagle to recruit a colleague by shooting them. If the Sheriff dies, the Deputy dies too.

short.en: Assists the Sheriff after being recruited.

desc.en: The Deputy joins the Sheriff's team and can be recruited with a shot from the Sheriff’s gun.

short.en: Tracks footprints and blood trails left by killers.

desc.en: The Sniffer can see footsteps and blood left by killers, helping identify suspects.

short.en: Gains a damage multiplier for killing Traitors.

desc.en: The Vigilante gains a damage multiplier by killing Traitors, but loses it when killing Innocents.

short.en: Works with Traitors but doesn't know their identities.

desc.en: The Accomplice works alongside the Traitor but doesn't know who they are. They can only buy one Traitor item and can't win alone.

short.en: Targets specific players for extra damage.

desc.en: The Executioner has a target and deals extra damage to them. Killing non-targets results in a delay before a new target is assigned.

short.en: Uses hunger to power their weapon and heal.

desc.en: The Glutton uses hunger to power their weapon, Devour, and can heal by eating corpses. If their hunger reaches zero, they transform into the Ravenous.

short.en: Must kill assigned targets to earn rewards.

desc.en: The Hitman needs to kill their assigned target to earn credits. If the target dies another way, no reward is given.

short.en: Kills to avoid Bloodlust, which damages them.

desc.en: The Vampire must kill a player every minute to avoid Bloodlust, which damages them. While in Bloodlust, they heal for a portion of the damage they deal.

short.en: Infects others and can respawn if their host is alive.

desc.en: The Infested infects others by killing them, turning them into allies. If they die, they can respawn as long as their host stays alive.

short.en: Revives bodies as zombies to fight for them.

desc.en: The Necromancer uses a defibrillator to revive dead bodies as zombies that fight for them. Zombies are slow and have limited ammo.

short.en: Uses a tracker to follow players' actions.

desc.en: The Serial Killer works alone, using a tracker item to see players' actions. They can steal credits but are not rewarded for kills.

short.en: Must kill everyone to win.

desc.en: The Ravenous must kill everyone else to win, losing all weapons except for their Devour and emitting a blood-red smoke trail.

short.en: Can revive multiple times with weakened stats.

desc.en: The Restless can die multiple times, reviving each time with weakened stats until they run out of lives.

short.en: Protects an assigned player but dies if they fail.

desc.en: The Bodyguard is assigned to protect a random player. If the protected player dies, the Bodyguard takes damage. If they kill their assigned player, they die.

short.en: Tries to get killed to win.

desc.en: The Jester's goal is to get killed by another player. If they are killed, they win, but they cannot kill themselves.

short.en: Marks players to win once enough are marked.

desc.en: The Marker marks players with a paintgun to win when enough players are marked. They can revive marked dead players. The Marker cannot deal damage and must be strategic in marking players.

short.en: Serves the holder of their contract.

desc.en: The Pirate serves the player holding their contract. If the current master dies, the contract is dropped, and the Pirates switch allegiance to the new holder.

short.en: Respawns with the killer's role if killed.

desc.en: The Unknown loses if they survive until the end. However, if killed by another player, they respawn with the killer’s role and assist them in winning.
